title: Easeout Weekly #30
body:
![Google Lighthouse](/images/uploads/lighthouse.png) [An Introduction To Running Lighthouse Programmatically](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/introduction-running-lighthouse-programmatically/) This article contains a brief introduction to Lighthouse, discusses the advantages of running it programmatically, and walks through a basic configuration. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/introduction-running-lighthouse-programmatically/)
![Smashing Magazine Birthday](/images/uploads/smashing-magazine-birthday-14.png) [Smashing Magazine Is Fourteen!](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/smashing-birthday-2020/) This week is the 14th birthday of Smashing Magazine. This article takes a look back at some memories from this year and previous years — with the help of the team and some Smashing friends. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/smashing-birthday-2020/)
![Next And MDX](/images/uploads/build-blog-nextjs-mdx-result.png) [How To Build A Blog With Next And MDX](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/build-blog-nextjs-mdx/) In this article we'll build a blog, step by step, using Next.js and MDX. Finally, we’ll cover why you would opt for Next.js instead of “vanilla” React and alternatives such as Gatsby. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/build-blog-nextjs-mdx/)
![Perspective Cubes](/images/uploads/perspective-cubes.png) [How CSS Perspective Works](https://css-tricks.com/how-css-perspective-works/) In this article, we'll take a look at the concept of perspective, starting with the very basics, as we work up to a fully animated 3D cube. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-css-perspective-works/)
![Ant and Vue Logos](/images/uploads/ant-design-vue.jpg) [Setting up and Customizing the Ant Design System in a Nuxt App](https://css-tricks.com/setting-up-and-customizing-the-ant-design-system-in-a-nuxt-app/) [Nuxt](https://nuxtjs.org/) and Ant Design work well together, in part because of Nuxt’s code-splitting and tree-shaking abilities, not to mention [Nuxt’s new static target deployment option](https://nuxtjs.org/blog/going-full-static/). Combining the two can be a little tricky, so what follows are the steps you need to set it up! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/setting-up-and-customizing-the-ant-design-system-in-a-nuxt-app/)
![Craft CMS Logo](/images/uploads/craft-cms.png) [Get Up And Running With Craft CMS](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/craft-cms/) Choosing what CMS to use in your next development project is a critical decision for any business, large or small. In this guide, we’re going to run through the potential of Craft CMS. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/craft-cms/)
![JavaScript Media Queries Comparison](/images/uploads/js-media-queries.png) [Working with JavaScript Media Queries](https://css-tricks.com/working-with-javascript-media-queries/) A look at how to implement Media Queries using JavaScript. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/working-with-javascript-media-queries/)
![API Testing With Postman](/images/uploads/postman-automate-api-testing.png) [How To Automate API Testing With Postman](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/automate-api-testing-postman/) In this article, we will learn how to write automated tests on web APIs with Postman. In order to follow along to this tutorial, you’ll need at least a fair amount of familiarity with Postman. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/automate-api-testing-postman/)
![Smashing Podcast Episode 24 Article Card](/images/uploads/smashing-podcast-episode-24.png) [Smashing Podcast Episode 24 With Cassie Evans: What Is SVG Animation?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/smashing-podcast-episode-24/) We’re talking about SVG Animation. How can vector images, JavaScript and CSS all work together to provide engaging motion graphics? Drew McLellan talks to SVG expert Cassie Evans to find out. [Listen up ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/smashing-podcast-episode-24/)
![ Motion Sensitivities Consideration](/images/uploads/design-reduced-motion-sensitivities.png) [Designing With Reduced Motion For Motion Sensitivities](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/design-reduced-motion-sensitivities/) Thanks to the wide support of the prefers-reduced-motion-media feature, we now have more advanced ways to design motion that can be creative and innovative while also being safer for those with motion sensitivities. This article is all about the how and why of making that happen. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/09/design-reduced-motion-sensitivities/)
![Shoptalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Cognitive Bias with David Dylan Thomas](https://shoptalkshow.com/429/) David Dylan Thomas stops by to talk about his new book, Design for Cognitive Bias, recently published by A Book Apart. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/429/)
![Terminal Windows Illustration](/images/uploads/terminal-windows.jpg) [One Action, Multiple Terminal Windows Running Stuff](https://css-tricks.com/one-action-multiple-terminal-windows-running-stuff/) A neat little article, taking a look at how to best manage multiple terminal windows. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/one-action-multiple-terminal-windows-running-stuff/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
